body_html:
Well that URL is for Python2. You can use Python2 on Arch

sudo pacman -S python2-pip
sudo pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.7.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

For Python3, there is only a pre-built for Python3.4, while arch is with Python3.5. You can either compile tensorflow yourself, or download the binary for 3.4 and rename "cp34" to "cp35" to make it work.
body_text:
Well that URL is for Python2.  You can use Python2 on Arch
sudo pacman -S python2-pip
sudo pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.7.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
For Python3, there is only a pre-built for Python3.4, while arch is with Python3.5. You can either compile tensorflow yourself, or download the binary for 3.4 and rename "cp34" to "cp35" to make it work.
body:
Well that URL is for Python2.  You can use Python2 on Arch

``` bash
sudo pacman -S python2-pip
sudo pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.7.1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
```

For Python3, there is only a pre-built for Python3.4, while arch is with Python3.5. You can either compile tensorflow yourself, or download the binary for 3.4 and rename "cp34" to "cp35" to make it work.
